info.description:
# activiti 

- Activiti is battle-tested Business Process Management. Organizations across the world depend on the open source platform in a huge range of demanding situations. It supports open standards with BPMN and DMN so you can create processes that suit you.
info.title: Activiti REST API

get.summary: Get form data

200.description: Indicates that form data could be queried.

404.description: Indicates that form data could not be found.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the form data was submitted

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get historic activity instances

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: An id of the activity instance.

parameters.name: activityInstanceId
parameters.description: An id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: activityName
parameters.description: The name of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: activityType
parameters.description: The element type of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The execution id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: finished
parameters.description: Indication if the historic activity instance is finished.

parameters.name: taskAssignee
parameters.description: The assignee of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: The process instance id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: The process definition id of the historic activity instance.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return instances with the given tenantId.

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return instances with a tenantId like the given value.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: If true, only returns instances without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

200.description: Indicates that historic activity instances could be queried.

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get historic detail

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: The process instance id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The execution id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: activityInstanceId
parameters.description: The activity instance id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The task id of the historic detail.

parameters.name: selectOnlyFormProperties
parameters.description: Indication to only return form properties in the result.

parameters.name: selectOnlyVariableUpdates
parameters.description: Indication to only return variable updates in the result.

200.description: Indicates that historic detail could be queried.

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get the binary data for a historic detail variable
get.description: The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

200.description: Indicates the historic detail instance was found and the requested variable data is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested historic detail instance was not found or the historic detail instance doesn’t have a variable with the given name or the variable doesn’t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of historic task instances, but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the activities are returned

400.description: Indicates an parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information

post.description: All supported JSON parameter fields allowed are exactly the same as the parameters found for getting a collection of tasks (except for candidateGroupIn which is only available in this POST task query REST service), but passed in as JSON-body arguments rather than URL-parameters to allow for more advanced querying and preventing errors with request-uri’s that are too long. On top of that, the query allows for filtering based on task and process variables. The taskVariables and processInstanceVariables are both JSON-arrays containing objects with the format as described here.

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the tasks are returned.

400.description: Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format or that delegationState has an invalid value (other than pending and resolved). The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: List of tasks

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Only return models with the given version.

parameters.name: nameLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks with a name like the given name.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given description.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given priority.

parameters.name: minimumPriority
parameters.description: Only return tasks with a priority greater than the given value.

parameters.name: maximumPriority
parameters.description: Only return tasks with a priority lower than the given value.

parameters.name: assignee
parameters.description: Only return tasks assigned to the given user.

parameters.name: assigneeLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks assigned with an assignee like the given value.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Only return tasks owned by the given user.

parameters.name: ownerLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks assigned with an owner like the given value.

parameters.name: unassigned
parameters.description: Only return tasks that are not assigned to anyone. If false is passed, the value is ignored.

parameters.name: delegationState
parameters.description: Only return tasks that have the given delegation state. Possible values are pending and resolved.

parameters.name: candidateUser
parameters.description: Only return tasks that can be claimed by the given user. This includes both tasks where the user is an explicit candidate for and task that are claimable by a group that the user is a member of.

parameters.name: candidateGroup
parameters.description: Only return tasks that can be claimed by a user in the given group.

parameters.name: candidateGroups
parameters.description: Only return tasks that can be claimed by a user in the given groups. Values split by comma.

parameters.name: involvedUser
parameters.description: Only return tasks in which the given user is involved.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given task definition id.

parameters.name: taskDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks with a given task definition id like the given value.

parameters.name: processInstanceId
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the process instance with the given id.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKey
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the process instance with the given business key.

parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKeyLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the process instance which has a business key like the given value.

parameters.name: processDefinitionId
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with the given id.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKey
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with the given key.

parameters.name: processDefinitionKeyLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with a key like the given value.

parameters.name: processDefinitionName
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with the given name.

parameters.name: processDefinitionNameLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of a process instance which has a process definition with a name like the given value.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the execution with the given id.

parameters.name: createdOn
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are created on the given date.

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are created before the given date.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are created after the given date.

parameters.name: dueOn
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are due on the given date.

parameters.name: dueBefore
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are due before the given date.

parameters.name: dueAfter
parameters.description: Only return tasks which are due after the given date.

parameters.name: withoutDueDate
parameters.description: Only return tasks which don’t have a due date. The property is ignored if the value is false.

parameters.name: excludeSubTasks
parameters.description: Only return tasks that are not a subtask of another task.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: If true, only return tasks that are not suspended (either part of a process that is not suspended or not part of a process at all). If false, only tasks that are part of suspended process instances are returned.

parameters.name: includeTaskLocalVariables
parameters.description: Indication to include task local variables in the result.

parameters.name: includeProcessVariables
parameters.description: Indication to include process variables in the result.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given tenantId.

parameters.name: tenantIdLike
parameters.description: Only return tasks with a tenantId like the given value.

parameters.name: withoutTenantId
parameters.description: If true, only returns tasks without a tenantId set. If false, the withoutTenantId parameter is ignored.

parameters.name: candidateOrAssigned
parameters.description: Select tasks that has been claimed or assigned to user or waiting to claim by user (candidate user or groups).

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Select tasks with the given category. Note that this is the task category, not the category of the process definition (namespace within the BPMN Xml).

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the tasks are returned

404.description: Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format or that delegationState has an invalid value (other than pending and resolved). The status-message contains additional information.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates request was successful and the tasks are returned

400.description: Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format or that delegationState has an invalid value (other than pending and resolved). The status-message contains additional information.

get.summary: Get a task

200.description: Indicates the task was found and returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

post.description:
## Complete a task - Request Body

 ```JSON
{
  "action" : "complete",
  "variables" : []
} ```Completes the task. Optional variable array can be passed in using the variables property. More information about the variable format can be found in the REST variables section. Note that the variable-scope that is supplied is ignored and the variables are set on the parent-scope unless a variable exists in a local scope, which is overridden in this case. This is the same behavior as the TaskService.completeTask(taskId, variables) invocation.

Note that also a transientVariables property is accepted as part of this json, that follows the same structure as the variables property.


## Claim a task - Request Body 

 ```JSON
{
  "action" : "claim",
  "assignee" : "userWhoClaims"
} ```


Claims the task by the given assignee. If the assignee is null, the task is assigned to no-one, claimable again.


## Delegate a task - Request Body 

 ```JSON
{
  "action" : "delegate",
  "assignee" : "userToDelegateTo"
} ```


Delegates the task to the given assignee. The assignee is required.


## Suspend a process instance

 ```JSON
{
  "action" : "resolve"
} ```


Resolves the task delegation. The task is assigned back to the task owner (if any).

200.description: Indicates the action was executed.

400.description: When the body contains an invalid value or when the assignee is missing when the action requires it.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

409.description: Indicates the action cannot be performed due to a conflict. Either the task was updates simultaneously or the task was claimed by another user, in case of the claim action.

put.description: All request values are optional. For example, you can only include the assignee attribute in the request body JSON-object, only updating the assignee of the task, leaving all other fields unaffected. When an attribute is explicitly included and is set to null, the task-value will be updated to null. Example: {"dueDate" : null} will clear the duedate of the task).

200.description: Indicates the task was updated.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

409.description: Indicates the requested task was updated simultaneously.

parameters.name: cascadeHistory
parameters.description: Whether or not to delete the HistoricTask instance when deleting the task (if applicable). If not provided, this value defaults to false.

parameters.name: deleteReason
parameters.description: Reason why the task is deleted. This value is ignored when cascadeHistory is true.

204.description: Indicates the task was found and has been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

403.description: Indicates the requested task cannot be deleted because it’s part of a workflow.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get all attachments on a task

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the attachments are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

post.summary: Create a new attachment on a task, containing a link to an external resource or an attached file
post.description:
## Create a new attachment on a task, containing a link to an external resource

 ```JSON
{
  "name":"Simple attachment",
  "description":"Simple attachment description",
  "type":"simpleType",
  "externalUrl":"http://activiti.org"
} ```


Only the attachment name is required to create a new attachment.



## Create a new attachment on a task, with an attached file

The request should be of type multipart/form-data. There should be a single file-part included with the binary value of the variable. On top of that, the following additional form-fields can be present:

- *name*: Required name of the variable.

- *description*: Description of the attachment, optional.

- *type*: Type of attachment, optional. Supports any arbitrary string or a valid HTTP content-type.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the attachment was created and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates the attachment name is missing from the request.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get an attachment on a task

200.description: Indicates the task and attachment were found and the attachment is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the tasks doesn’t have a attachment with the given ID.

delete.summary: Delete an attachment on a task

204.description: Indicates the task and attachment were found and the attachment is deleted. Response body is left empty intentionally.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the tasks doesn’t have a attachment with the given ID.

get.summary: Get the content for an attachment
get.description: The response body contains the binary content. By default, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream unless the attachment type contains a valid Content-type.

200.description: Indicates the task and attachment was found and the requested content is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have an attachment with the given id or the attachment doesn’t have a binary stream available. Status message provides additional information.

get.summary: Get all comments on a task

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the task was found and the comments are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

post.summary: Create a new comment on a task

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the comment was created and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates the comment is missing from the request.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get a comment on a task

200.description: Indicates the task and comment were found and the comment is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the tasks doesn’t have a comment with the given ID.

delete.summary: Delete a comment on a task

204.description: Indicates the task and comment were found and the comment is deleted. Response body is left empty intentionally.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the tasks doesn’t have a comment with the given ID.

get.summary: Get all events for a task

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the events are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get an event on a task

200.description: Indicates the task and event were found and the event is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the tasks doesn’t have an event with the given ID.

delete.summary: Delete an event on a task

204.description: Indicates the task was found and the events are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have the requested event.

get.summary: Get all identity links for a task

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the requested identity links are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

post.summary: Create an identity link on a task

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the task was found and the identity link was created.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have the requested identityLink. The status contains additional information about this error.

get.summary: Get all identitylinks for a task for either groups or users
get.description:
## Get all identitylinks for a task URL

 ```
 GET runtime/tasks/{taskId}/identitylinks/users
GET runtime/tasks/{taskId}/identitylinks/groups  ```


Returns only identity links targetting either users or groups. Response body and status-codes are exactly the same as when getting the full list of identity links for a task.

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the requested identity links are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get a single identity link on a task

200.description: Indicates the task and identity link was found and returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have the requested identityLink. The status contains additional information about this error.

delete.summary: Delete an identity link on a task

204.description: Indicates the task and identity link were found and the link has been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have the requested identityLink. The status contains additional information about this error.

get.summary: Get list of sub tasks for a task

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the  sub tasks are returned

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get all variables for a task

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of variable to be returned. When local, only task-local variable value is returned. When global, only variable value from the task’s parent execution-hierarchy are returned. When the parameter is omitted, a local variable will be returned if it exists, otherwise a global variable.

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the requested variables are returned

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found..

post.summary: Create new variables on a task
post.description:
## Request body for creating simple (non-binary) variables

 ```JSON
[
  {
    "name" : "myTaskVariable",
    "scope" : "local",
    "type" : "string",
    "value" : "Hello my friend"
  },
  {

  }
] ```


The request body should be an array containing one or more JSON-objects representing the variables that should be created.

- *name*: Required name of the variable

scope: Scope of variable that is created. If omitted, local is assumed.

- *type*: Type of variable that is created. If omitted, reverts to raw JSON-value type (string, boolean, integer or double).

- *value*: Variable value.

More information about the variable format can be found in the REST variables section.


## Request body for Creating a new binary variable

The request should be of type multipart/form-data. There should be a single file-part included with the binary value of the variable. On top of that, the following additional form-fields can be present:

- *name*: Required name of the variable.

scope: Scope of variable that is created. If omitted, local is assumed.

- *type*: Type of variable that is created. If omitted, binary is assumed and the binary data in the request will be stored as an array of bytes.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the variables were created and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates the name of a variable to create was missing or that an attempt is done to create a variable on a standalone task (without a process associated) with scope global or an empty array of variables was included in the request or request did not contain an array of variables. Status message provides additional information.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

409.description: Indicates the task already has a variable with the given name. Use the PUT method to update the task variable instead.

415.description: Indicates the serializable data contains an object for which no class is present in the JVM running the Flowable engine and therefore cannot be deserialized.

delete.summary: Delete all local variables on a task

204.description: Indicates all local task variables have been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

get.summary: Get a variable from a task

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of variable to be returned. When local, only task-local variable value is returned. When global, only variable value from the task’s parent execution-hierarchy are returned. When the parameter is omitted, a local variable will be returned if it exists, otherwise a global variable.

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the requested variables are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have a variable with the given name (in the given scope). Status message provides additional information.

put.summary: Update an existing variable on a task
put.description:
## Request body for updating simple (non-binary) variables

 ```JSON
{
  "name" : "myTaskVariable",
  "scope" : "local",
  "type" : "string",
  "value" : "Hello my friend"
} ```


- *name*: Required name of the variable

- *scope*: Scope of variable that is updated. If omitted, local is assumed.

- *type*: Type of variable that is updated. If omitted, reverts to raw JSON-value type (string, boolean, integer or double).

- *value*: Variable value.


## Request body for updating simple (non-binary) variables

The request should be of type multipart/form-data. There should be a single file-part included with the binary value of the variable. On top of that, the following additional form-fields can be present:

- *name*: Required name of the variable.

- *scope*: Scope of variable that is updated. If omitted, local is assumed.

- *type*: Type of variable that is updated. If omitted, binary is assumed and the binary data in the request will be stored as an array of bytes.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of variable to be returned. When local, only task-local variable value is returned. When global, only variable value from the task’s parent execution-hierarchy are returned. When the parameter is omitted, a local variable will be returned if it exists, otherwise a global variable.

200.description: Indicates the variables was updated and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates the name of a variable to update was missing or that an attempt is done to update a variable on a standalone task (without a process associated) with scope global. Status message provides additional information.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have a variable with the given name in the given scope. Status message contains additional information about the error.

415.description: Indicates the serializable data contains an object for which no class is present in the JVM running the Flowable engine and therefore cannot be deserialized.

delete.summary: Delete a variable on a task

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of variable to be returned. When local, only task-local variable value is returned. When global, only variable value from the task’s parent execution-hierarchy are returned. When the parameter is omitted, a local variable will be returned if it exists, otherwise a global variable.

204.description: Indicates the task variable was found and has been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have a variable with the given name. Status message contains additional information about the error.

get.summary: Get the binary data for a variable
get.description: The response body contains the binary value of the variable. When the variable is of type binary, the content-type of the response is set to application/octet-stream, regardless of the content of the variable or the request accept-type header. In case of serializable, application/x-java-serialized-object is used as content-type.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope of variable to be returned. When local, only task-local variable value is returned. When global, only variable value from the task’s parent execution-hierarchy are returned. When the parameter is omitted, a local variable will be returned if it exists, otherwise a global variable.

200.description: Indicates the task was found and the requested variables are returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task doesn’t have a variable with the given name (in the given scope). Status message provides additional information.

type.description: Can be any arbitrary value. When a valid formatted media-type (e.g. application/xml, text/plain) is included, the binary content HTTP response content-type will be set the the given value.

externalUrl.description: contentUrl:In case the attachment is a link to an external resource, the externalUrl contains the URL to the external content. If the attachment content is present in the Flowable engine, the contentUrl will contain an URL where the binary content can be streamed from.

delegationState.description: Delegation-state of the task, can be null, "pending" or "resolved".
